qas.question: What is the official that oversees the operation of NARA?
What member of NARA has the ability to declare when the constitutional threshold of passage has ocurred?

plausible_answers.text: the National Archives and Records Administration

qas.question: What do state legislatures oversee the operation of?
What kind of documentation is maintained by the state legislatures?

plausible_answers.text: to declare when the constitutional threshold for passage has been reached

qas.question: What authority do the state legislatures have?

plausible_answers.text: when an act has become an amendment

qas.question: What do state legislatures decide about acts?
What is the title used by state legislatures when overseeing  NARA?

context: <a0_0><a1_0>The Archivist<a1_0/><a0_0/> of the United States is the <b6_0>chief official<b6_0/> overseeing the operation of <b2_0>the National Archives and Records Administration<b2_0/>. The Archivist not only maintains the <b3_0>official<b3_0/> documentation of the passage of amendments to the U.S. Constitution by state legislatures, but has the authority <b4_0>to declare when the constitutional threshold for passage has been reached<b4_0/>, and therefore <b5_0>when an act has become an amendment<b5_0/>.
